alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued December 04 at 5:15PM ChST until December 09 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST MONDAY ALONG NORTH AND EAST FACING FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH MONDAY MORNING ALONG NORTH FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON ALONG EAST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 10 to 12 feet along east facing reefs and 7 to 9 feet along north facing reefs . For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM ChST Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Monday morning along north facing reefs and through Friday afternoon along east facing reefs. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
